comment: Stephen Goss throws projects on us and gives us little time to do it. He doesn't grade anything. We do lots of presentations/whole group discussion so he gives feedback in person. Must be in attendance because he barely posts online. Overall easy class, will be hard for those who cannot work with his disorganization.

Dr. Goss is an amazing professor, definitely take him if you can! He is very wise, and his class is so comforting and laid back. This class is project-heavy, but every project is enjoyable and every class is exciting. He is an amazing, respectful professor who takes the time to know each of his students, and you can tell teaching is his passion.

This class was organized in a very poor way. We abandoned multiple books and projects because Dr. Goss' pacing for the course was... not good. Our final projects were VERY VERY rushed as well, meanwhile other classes worked on theirs for the whole semester. Regardless, he isn't a bad person, just a bit full of himself at times and semi-neglectful.

Dr Goss initially appears as an incredibly kind and genuine person, but quickly revealed a disorganization and hypocrisy that greatly impacted my respect and ability to learn from him. While he emphasizes the role of student participation, his class was filled with personal anecdotes that demeaned those who participated. Great if you want an A.

Dr. Goss seems nice enough, but this online graduate class is a stressful amount of busy work and he should know that graduate students are extremely busy. In addition, it is halfway through the semester and there is not. a. single. grade. posted and NO FEEDBACK whatsoever. I think I will get an A (will update) but this is annoying and he is lazy

Dr. Goss is a wonderful teacher - probably one of the best I've ever had. He really cares about his students and you can tell teaching is his passion. I learned so much about teaching from just coming to class and observing him. If he is teaching a class you need - take him 100%!

The class is super easy and he is super nice. He takes the time to get know all of his students and cares about how they are doing in and out of the classroom. He is also very passionate about the material but his classroom management style could use some work.

Dr. Goss is the BEST professor I've had at KSU! Very discussion/participation heavy. No quizzes or assignments (other than light reading), all work is done in class. Dr. Goss is full of great teaching advice and knows how to make a class tons of fun. Seriously, he's so wise. 10/10 recommend his class!

Super nice and cool, you can tell he cares about the grammar he teaches & wants us to understand it. Give good ideas for future teaching (I'm EDUC major). One of my favorite professors. Reading assigned every class but not hard. most of class is group conversation/work. 10/10 would recommend.
